0:
The office of Secretary of State for Constitutional Affairs was a British Government position, created in 2003.
Triplets: <Secretary of State for Constitutional Affairs
1:
--------------------
Text: Secretary of State for Constitutional Affairs:  Certain functions of the Lord Chancellor which related to the Lord Chancellor's Department were transferred to the Secretary of State.
Triplets:<Secretary of State
2:
--------------------
Text: Secretary of State for Constitutional Affairs:  At a later date further functions were also transferred to the Secretary of State for Constitutional Affairs from the First Secretary of State, a position within the government held by the Deputy Prime Minister.
Triplets:<Secretary of State
